pages.title: Heat Cables
pages.text: <item>Heat Cables/$ transport heat by balancing their temperature with their neighbors. However, if a <item>heat cable/$ gets above its <thing>melting temperature/$, it will break. Make sure your heat networks are using at least as much heat as they make, or your cables will melt!$(br2)<item>Heat Cables/$ also have

a <thing>loss/$, which is how much their temperature will move towards the <thing>biome temperature/$ each tick. There are many types of <item>heat cables/$ with different stats- different <thing>melting points/$ and <thing>loss rates/$. Ceramic and obsidian are usually best- but wool will do in a pinch! There are also ice cables that have extremely low <thing>heat loss/$, but melt at 0Â°C.$(br2)Cables can be disconnected from each other via wrench. Cables can also be reskined
by right clicking with iron, diamond, or nether quartz.
There are also <item>Redstone Heat Cables/$. They only connect to other cables and machines when they have a redstone signal. $(l:essentials/circuits)Circuits/$ can read the temperature in Kelvin.
